findings.lower_thorax: Lung bases are clear. No suspicious pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions.
findings.liver: Normal in size with slight heterogeneous enhancement of segments 4 and 5 due to increased inflammation in the gallbladder.
findings.biliary: Small stone in the cystic duct obstructing it and the gallbladder filled with sludge and stones. Gallbladder wall irregular with few areas of mucosal disruption and mild pericholecystic stranding.
findings.pancreas: Normal in bulk and appearance, with normal main pancreatic duct.
findings.spleen: Normal in size with a subcentimeter splenic cyst in the inferior pole.
findings.kidneys: Normal in size with no evidence for hydronephrosis or focal renal lesions.
findings.vasculature: Abdominal aorta and major branches normal in caliber.
findings.osseous_soft_tissue_structures: No suspicious bony lesions, hemangioma identified at lower thoracic spine.
